name: Kiplot
description:
Kiplot lets our clients automate beautiful stories and reports, from any data source using proven information design principles. The app’s direct integration with our client’s data sources means that their reports are always up to date and ready to make an impact.

Our primary focus is to help organisations automate agile reporting and project portfolio reporting in an impressive and impactful way. We add structure and insight to agile processes by providing predictive capabilities. Moreover, we create immediate and actionable overviews of project portfolios covering hundreds of millions (GBP) worth of company budget.

We work with large and medium-size organisations ranging from established, large enterprises to our fellow startups.

team.name: Paul Aanhaanen
team.bioHtml: Founder @Kiplot • Worked at @Capco

team.title: Software Engineer
team.name: James William Morda Barford-Evans
team.bioHtml: Proficient in both frontend and backend code. Utilising JavaScript/Typescript along with Node.js, React & Redux, Express

jobs.title: Customer Operations and Implementation Analyst
jobs.description:
At Kiplot, we enable organisations to integrate their existing systems, spreadsheets and plans to provide automated insights and optimise the delivery of their projects.

Our customers vary from large financial institutions, consultancies and start-ups.
As we continue to grow, we are looking for a Customer Operations and Implementation Analyst to join our team and be part of our success story.

About the Role
As Customer Operations and Implementation Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting our customers throughout the onboarding life cycle of our software and assisting with their ongoing needs providing best in class support. 

You will be working with a diverse mix of creative, curious, hardworking and smart people who genuinely care about making a difference for our customers. You will have a mind for getting things done and a passion for helping drive customer-centric improvements.

It’s an exciting environment where no two days are the same!

A typical day will see you:
•	Guiding our clients through the onboarding life cycle / system updates
•	Educating our customers on how to best utilise our software 
•	Managing day-to-day interactions with our customers
•	Investigating product related customer issues and reporting back to our product teams
•	Conducting user training sessions both face-to-face and via webinars
•	Gathering feedback, analysing data usage to derive insights and provide information around trends and patterns to improve our Product Roadmap and Business Strategy
•	Writing and publishing content for our website and FAQ page

You will have:
•	Basic knowledge of SaaS (Software as a Service) 
•	Demonstratable project management skills
•	Ability to build and maintain solid stakeholder relationships 
•	Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritise duties
•	Willingness to travel to customer sites both nationally and internationally if required
•	Proficiency in SQL beneficial but not essential (we can teach you!)
 
Benefits:
•	Competitive salary
•	25 days Annual Leave
•	Pension scheme 
•	Monthly team lunches and quarterly gatherings
•	Highly sociable, growing team where you will have the ability to contribute from Day 1

jobs.title: Customer Success Manager
jobs.description:
We are a data visualisation company based just off Old Street, London. We are looking for a Customer Success Manager to join our start-up, and help us grow.
 
The role is to help our clients, ranging from startups to consultancies and banks, to get the most out of their software.

This is an exciting opportunity to join growing start-up, with foundations built on the using the latest information design principles and best technologies to turn data into engaging visual reports and inspire better decisions. 
 
As a candidate, you must be willing to inject energy and pace into delivering our product and be attracted to the challenge of developing your skills as well as learning new ones. You would typically have 1-2 years' experience in a Software as a Service (SaaS), Consulting or customer facing role.

You must already have the right to work in the UK.

Responsibilities:
 
Listen and understand our customers' needs and engage with them on how our software can be use
Act as an ambassador for our software on client-sites to embed our product with target audiences and further our company brand
Identify opportunities to broaden our product's usage and turn opportunity into increased revenues
Gather continual feedback on usage (volumes, use cases and growth opportunities) in order to inform our Product Roadmap and Business Strategy
 
Requirements
 
Strong academic record; Bachelor's Degree at 2:1 or above
Evidence of successful stakeholder management, ideally in a Software or Consulting capacity 
Demonstrable knowledge and passion for at least one of the following disciplines; Information Design, Data Visualisation, Enterprise Reporting, Data Warehouse
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with evidence of proactive stakeholder management and some level of conflict resolution
A self-starter who can collaborate ideas with the team and demonstrate autonomous decision making and leadership skills
Ideally, some exposure to SQL databases and query language (but not essential)
 
 
Benefits:
 
- £35k - £45k depending on level and experience
- We're open to good ideas
- This is not a boring, corporate job: you'll be learning a lot
- We're a small team (currently 5), you'll be able to make a big impact
- We’re intending to grow the team rapidly. You will help shape the bigger vision
- We've got some great clients: a mix of banks, startups and consultancies
- We're not cheap: if it'll make you happy and productive to have a cinema's worth of displays, or a coffee-machine that makes baristas weep, just ask

jobs.title: Senior Javascript Engineer
jobs.description:
# About Cubik
The Cubik web app lets our clients automate beautiful stories and reports, from any data source using proven information design principles. The app’s direct integration with our client’s data sources means that their reports are always up to date and ready to make an impact.

We also provide a tailored service. Working with our clients, we configure algorithms to apply our expertise to their specific business problems, resulting in rich data sources for our clients’ to inform their decision making.

Our primary focus is to help organisations automate agile reporting and project portfolio reporting in an impressive and impactful way. We add structure and insight to agile processes by providing predictive capabilities. Moreover, we create immediate and actionable overviews of project portfolios covering hundreds of millions (GBP) worth of company budget.

## Who it is for
We work with large and medium-size organisations ranging from established, large enterprises to our fellow startups. Within our clients’ organisations, any user can automate beautifully designed reports using the Cubik app’s integrated data sources. Our clients include The Co-operative Bank, 10x, Piccadilly Group and Live Lend. 

## Our company’s character
We’re always looking for great people to join the team. We have a range of challenges using the latest technologies and offer every new team member the opportunity to make an impact. We’re also a small, fun-loving company where every person strongly influences our culture.

## Engineering at Cubik
We are a small team, currently six engineers across frontend, backend and infrastructure responsibilities. We work with a Kanban/ticket process, and releases to production happen frequently. 

We use the latest technologies and are open to new ideas. If there is a new technology that has benefit for Cubik, we will back it. We believe typings have much value in our large, sophisticated code base and use Typescript throughout the technology stack.

The frontend application has React, Redux and D3 technologies and for the backend application, we use Node, Express and Postgres. We use Git, Gitlab and Webpack for tooling and make sure all code is tested and run through CI/CD on its way to production.

The team mostly use MacBooks, but we also have Linux and Windows enthusiasts.

## The hiring process for engineers
1. A 30-minute phone call for Cubik and you to get to know each other better and answer any questions you may have
2. Share some code from personal projects for us to see. If you do not have anything to share we will provide you with a take-home exercise
3. A 1-2 hour interview on site where you will meet the CTO and other members of the team. Our focus will be on your technical expertise and whether you would like to work within our team
4. Meet the founders, learn about the vision of the company, and see whether this is a journey you want to be on
